fields_of_interest: Economy, finance and the euro, Banking and financial services
eu_initiatives: Regulation (EU) 2017/ 1131 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 14 June 2017 on money market funds.
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
goals__remit:
The Institutional Money Market Funds Association (IMMFA) is the trade association which represents the European stable NAV money market funds industry (both distributing and accumulating funds). 
 
IMMFA seeks to promote and support development of this industry by: 
 
- ensuring that IMMFA members offer a consistently high quality product to investors, in particular by maintaining a set of best practice standards in its Code of Practice; 
 
- informing and influencing policy makers, regulators and authorities regarding money market fund issues; and 
 
- educating investors about money market funds and providing timely data on members' funds. 
 
All IMMFA members agree to abide by the IMMFA Code of Practice.
relevant_communication: We assist members in implementing EU legislation. We communicate on their behalf with EU institutions, including MEPs, financial services attaches and Commission staff. This is face to face and in writing. We also prepare and distribute papers and relevant data on the money market fund industry.
legal_status: UK company limited by a guarantee, not for profit organisaton
